div1.p: This report discusses experiments conducted on guinea pigs.

div1.head: Report: Effect of the Serums of Dr. Hanson and of Dr. Iglesias upon Leptospira icteroides, [s.n.], June 19, 1923
div1.p:
June 20, 1923 EFFECT OF DR. HANSON'S SERUM ON LEPTOSPIRA ICTEROIDES
AND LEPTOSPIRA ICTEROHAEMORRHAGIAE

Experiments and observations undertaken jointly by Drs. Russell, Nichols,
Hanson, Muller, Dieterich, Iglesias, and Noguchi.

row.cell:
1. Cedeno (Guayaquil) culture, 0.5 cc.
Hanson's serum, 0.5 cc.
Saline, 1.5 cc.

2. Vilela (Peru) culture, 0.5 cc.
Hanson's serum, 0.5 cc.
Saline, 1.5 cc.

Partial agglutination
and immobilization
(after 10 to 15 min.)

3. Merida (Mexico) culture, 0.5 cc.
Hanson's serum, 0.5 cc.
Saline, 1.5 cc.

Partial agglutination
and fragmentation
(after 10 to 15 min.)

Almost complete
lysis in 1 hour
25 minutes

4. Group 30 culture, 0.5 cc.
Hanson's serum, 0.5 cc.
Saline, 1.5 cc.

5. American #2 culture, 0.5 cc.
Hanson's serum, 0.5 cc.
Saline, 1.5 cc.

div1.p:
*Both guinea pigs were killed at the end of 1 hour and
30 minutes. There was no fluid in the peritoneal cavity,
showing that the injections by Dr. Muller were made in-
to the intestine.
